column4: hi - Trying to Internet Explorer v.6 in Wine - Anyone know the best way to do this ? ?
in windows
I do not care for IE personally - trying to get NetFlicks to work with watching movies over the internet.
I thought that netflicks had a linux portion.. could be wrong.. how bout installing virtualbox and then install windows in that.. ?
in the mean time.. www.hulu.com :)
That is probably the only way - Not up to running any Windows app on Intrepid box anyway. Thanks for the idea though.
vbox runs native.. I need ie6 for work.. that's my way.. and I can use vbox to check out other distros
yea - what a pain sometimes - the netflicks uses silverlight instead of regular flash as well.
there is a silverlight linux version.. moonlight? something like that
hmmm - might check it out might be a work around ...... thx
Found the moonlight - installed plugin & restarted FFox - went to netflix - but alas it is a no go - tried :o( - If I get ambitious will go with VBox ....
Thanks for suggestions and help appreciate it....
no problem.. I was just looking too.. looks like vbox is the only solution.

yea - I got IE6 running from a terminal window but Netflix complains about having have cookies enabled - but no toolbar etc or place in this funky IE to get this to happen < http://bookmarks.honewatson.com/2008/12/17/ie6-internet-exporer-install-ubuntu-ibex-intrepid-wine-tricks/ >
a constant struggle
That's ok I still love run'n my ubuntu box verse's a spyware ridden windows box any day of the week - just keep trying right?
yep
Are you running ubuntu-offtopic as well?
not currently ..
just wanted to mention something - but this not right forum for it
